alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 15 at 6:38AM AKDT until March 16 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Snow Followed by Heavy Rain for Southeast Alaska... .Snow arrives to the central and northern Panhandle late Tuesday night through Thursday. Confidence is increasing that the far northern Panhandle, including Haines and Skagway, will see heavy snow while warming temperatures change snow over to rain for the Icy Strait Corridor. Precipitation is still expected to start as snow along the Icy Strait Corridor, but a general 2 to 4 inches is expected as a change to rain should limit any significant accumulations. As for Yakutat, the main plume of moisture is expected to develop to the east limiting snow accumulations. That being said, by Thursday evening, the main plume of moisture is expected to shift to west, increasing the possibility for Yakutat to see significant snow accumulations. Yakutat`s snow accumulations will be extremely dependent on where the plume of moisture develops so this trend will be monitored closely throughout this event. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow followed by heavy rain. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...From 4 AM Wednesday to 6 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to change to rain by Wednesday night with warming temperatures. Heavy rain on existing snow pack and icy roads will make very slick conditions and travel difficult. Ponding of water in culverts, roadways, driveways, and yards is likely.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
